  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Sets up initial customer appointment viewing to all appointments. Disables all edit fields (because no appointment is selected yet).
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - JavaFX param.
      resourceBundle - JavaFX param.

    • LoadTable

      public void LoadTable(int selection)
      Loads table to display whatever view the user has selected from :All, month, or week.
      Parameters:
      selection - int corresponding to the view. 1 for all, 2 for month, 3 for week.

    • customerSelected

      public void customerSelected(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Triggers when a customer combo box is selected when editing. Resets date and time selects because the schedule is customer dependent. Locks the flow of selection to Customer -> Date -> Start Time -> End Time, to avoid schedule conflicts from being created.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - fires when Customer combo box is selected.

    • updateStartTimeSelection

      public void updateStartTimeSelection(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Triggers when a date is selected when editing. Allows the user to now select a start time. Locks are in place to force the flow of selection to Customer -> Date -> Start Time -> End Time, to avoid schedule conflicts from being created. Also rejects the user from picking a weekend by not unlocking unless a weekday is selected. Populates the possible start times to be between the business hours and not during an other appointment (for the same customer).
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - fires when a date from the date picker is selected.

    • updateEndTimeSelection

      public void updateEndTimeSelection(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Triggers when a start time is selected when editing. Allows the user to now select an end time. Locks are in place to force the flow of selection to Customer -> Date -> Start Time -> End Time, to avoid schedule conflicts from being created. Populates the possible end times to be between the start time and the start of the next appointment or end of day.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - fires when a date from the date picker is selected.
